head.title: Palm Beach to Bahamas By 99-Minute Hydrofoil

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Hospitality, Restaurant and Travel

hedline.hl1: Palm Beach to Bahamas By 99-Minute Hydrofoil

abstract.p: Sea Jets company begins hydrofoil service between Palm Beach and Grand Bahama Island; 65-mile trip takes 99 minutes (S)

block.p: Sea Jets, a new company based in Riviera Beach, Fla., has started hydrofoil service between Palm Beach, Fla., and Grand Bahama Island. Sea Jets' hydrofoils, called jetfoils and made by Boeing, can skim the surface of the water at more than 50 miles an hour and hold 250 passengers.

The boats are entirely enclosed, with seating areas much like an aircraft's. Like air travelers, passengers are served soft drinks and snacks by cabin attendants. Beer, wine and liquor are available at extra cost.

Sea Jets, a new company based in Riviera Beach, Fla., has started hydrofoil service between Palm Beach, Fla., and Grand Bahama Island. Sea Jets' hydrofoils, called jetfoils and made by Boeing, can skim the surface of the water at more than 50 miles an hour and hold 250 passengers.

The boats are entirely enclosed, with seating areas much like an aircraft's. Like air travelers, passengers are served soft drinks and snacks by cabin attendants. Beer, wine and liquor are available at extra cost.

The hydrofoils make two round trips between the Port of Palm Beach and Freeport every day except Tuesday and Wednesday, when there are no trips. Departures from Palm Beach for the 65-mile, 99-minute journey are at 9 a.m. and 4:30 p.m.; return trips are at noon and 7 p.m. Round-trip tickets cost $99 to $115, plus $25 tax; $49 to $55, plus tax, for ages 3 to 16. Information and reservations: (877) 273-2538.
